intro: Monilaria chrysoleuca f. purpurea, commonly known as the purple-flowered coral tree, is a striking ornamental plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features lanceolate leaves with a smooth texture and a pale green underside. Its flowering period typically occurs in the spring and early summer, producing vibrant purple to pink blooms. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
